<style>
.font-preview-page {
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 6rem 2rem 4rem 2rem;
}

.font-preview-page h1 {
  font-family: 'Space Grotesk', sans-serif;
  font-size: 2rem;
  font-weight: 700;
  margin-bottom: 0.5rem;
  color: #fff;
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-preview-page h1 { color: #1a1a1a; }

.font-preview-page .page-subtitle {
  font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif;
  font-size: 0.9rem;
  color: rgba(255,255,255,0.6);
  margin-bottom: 2rem;
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-preview-page .page-subtitle { color: #666; }

.font-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(2, 1fr);
  gap: 1.5rem;
}

@media (max-width: 800px) {
  .font-grid { grid-template-columns: 1fr; }
}

.font-card {
  border-radius: 16px;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.1);
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.05);
  transition: border-color 0.3s ease, box-shadow 0.3s ease, transform 0.3s ease;
  text-decoration: none;
  color: inherit;
  display: block;
  cursor: pointer;
}

.font-card:hover {
  border-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.25);
  box-shadow: 0 10px 30px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);
  transform: translateY(-4px);
  text-decoration: none;
  color: inherit;
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card {
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.8);
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card:hover {
  border-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.2);
  box-shadow: 0 10px 30px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
}

.font-card-hero {
  position: relative;
  height: 180px;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.font-card-hero img {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  object-fit: cover;
}

.font-card-hero .overlay {
  position: absolute;
  top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, transparent 0%, rgba(0,0,0,0.6) 100%);
}

.font-card-hero .hero-text {
  position: absolute;
  top: 50%;
  left: 50%;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  gap: 1.5rem;
  z-index: 1;
}

.font-card-hero .hero-title {
  font-size: 1.6rem;
  font-weight: 300;
  line-height: 1.1;
  color: #fff;
  text-shadow: 0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);
  margin: 0;
  white-space: nowrap;
}

.font-card-hero .hero-divider {
  width: 1px;
  height: 60px;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.5);
}

.font-card-hero .hero-roles {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  gap: 0.4rem;
}

.font-card-hero .hero-roles span {
  font-size: 0.55rem;

}

.font-card-body {

}

.font-card-label {

  justify-content: space-between;
  align-items: baseline;
  margin-bottom: 0.75rem;
  padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
  border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.08);
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card-label { border-bottom-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.06); }

.font-card-label .pairing-name {
  font-family: 'Space Grotesk', sans-serif;
  font-size: 0.85rem;
  font-weight: 600;
  color: #fff;
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card-label .pairing-name { color: #1a1a1a; }

.font-card-label .font-names {
  font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif;
  font-size: 0.65rem;
  color: rgba(255,255,255,0.4);
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card-label .font-names { color: #999; }

.font-card-body .sample-heading {
  font-size: 1.1rem;
  font-weight: 700;
  margin: 0 0 0.5rem 0;

}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card-body .sample-heading { color: #1a1a1a; }

.font-card-body .sample-text {
  font-size: 0.78rem;
  line-height: 1.6;
  color: rgba(255,255,255,0.6);
  margin: 0 0 0.6rem 0;
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card-body .sample-text { color: #555; }

.font-card-body .pros-cons {

  margin-top: 0.5rem;
}

.font-card-body .pros, .font-card-body .cons {
  flex: 1;
  font-size: 0.65rem;
  line-height: 1.5;
  color: rgba(255,255,255,0.45);
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card-body .pros,
body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card-body .cons { color: #888; }

.font-card-body .pros strong, .font-card-body .cons strong {
  display: block;
  font-size: 0.6rem;
  text-transform: uppercase;
  letter-spacing: 0.05em;
  margin-bottom: 0.2rem;
  color: rgba(255,255,255,0.6);
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card-body .pros strong,
body:not(.quarto-dark) .font-card-body .cons strong { color: #555; }

.current-badge {
  display: inline-block;
  font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif;
  font-size: 0.55rem;
  font-weight: 600;
  text-transform: uppercase;
  letter-spacing: 0.08em;
  padding: 0.15rem 0.5rem;
  border-radius: 999px;
  background: rgba(113, 178, 128, 0.25);
  color: #71b280;

  vertical-align: middle;
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .current-badge {

.section-divider {

}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .section-divider { color: #aaa; border-bottom-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.06); }

.back-link {

}

.back-link:hover { color: #fff; }

body:not(.quarto-dark) .back-link:hover { color: #1a1a1a; }

.click-hint {
  font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif;

  margin-top: 2rem;
}

body:not(.quarto-dark) .click-hint { color: #aaa; }
</style>

<div class="font-preview-page">
  <a href="../index.html" class="back-link">&larr; Back to home</a>
  <h1>Font Pairing Preview</h1>
  <p class="page-subtitle">Click any card to see the full landing page rendered with that font pairing.</p>

  <div class="section-divider">Sans-Serif Pairings</div>

  <div class="font-grid">

    <!-- 1. Current: Space Grotesk + Inter -->
    <a href="preview.html?h=Space+Grotesk&b=Inter&label=Current" class="font-card">
      <div class="font-card-hero">
        <img src="../images/wide_maroc.jpg" alt="Preview">
        <div class="overlay"></div>
        <div class="hero-text">
          <div class="hero-title" style="font-family:'Space Grotesk',sans-serif;">Bringing<br>Data to<br>Life</div>
          <div class="hero-divider"></div>
          <div class="hero-roles">
            <span style="font-family:'Space Grotesk',sans-serif;">Applied Data Scientist</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Space Grotesk',sans-serif;">Software Engineer</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Space Grotesk',sans-serif;">Product Leader</span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="font-card-body">
        <div class="font-card-label">
          <span class="pairing-name">Current <span class="current-badge">Active</span></span>
          <span class="font-names">Space Grotesk + Inter</span>
        </div>
        <div class="sample-heading" style="font-family:'Space Grotesk',sans-serif;">The Baseline</div>
        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'Inter',sans-serif;">Geometric and technical without being cold. Space Grotesk's monospaced DNA gives headings a subtle coder credibility, while Inter is the invisible workhorse body font &mdash; it never distracts.</p>
        <div class="pros-cons">
          <div class="pros" style="font-family:'Inter',sans-serif;"><strong>Strengths</strong>Recognizably "tech." Great at small sizes. Massive weight range in Inter.</div>
          <div class="cons" style="font-family:'Inter',sans-serif;"><strong>Tradeoffs</strong>Very common pairing in dev/data portfolios. Can feel generic if not styled well.</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </a>

    <!-- 2. Sora + DM Sans -->
    <a href="preview.html?h=Sora&b=DM+Sans&label=Modern+Tech" class="font-card">
      <div class="font-card-hero">
        <img src="../images/wide_maroc.jpg" alt="Preview">
        <div class="overlay"></div>
        <div class="hero-text">
          <div class="hero-title" style="font-family:'Sora',sans-serif;">Bringing<br>Data to<br>Life</div>
          <div class="hero-divider"></div>
          <div class="hero-roles">
            <span style="font-family:'Sora',sans-serif;">Applied Data Scientist</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Sora',sans-serif;">Software Engineer</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Sora',sans-serif;">Product Leader</span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="font-card-body">
        <div class="font-card-label">
          <span class="pairing-name" style="font-family:'Sora',sans-serif;">Modern Tech</span>
          <span class="font-names">Sora + DM Sans</span>
        </div>
        <div class="sample-heading" style="font-family:'Sora',sans-serif;">Precise but Rounded</div>
        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;">Sora feels like Space Grotesk's slightly friendlier sibling &mdash; same geometric skeleton, but softer terminals. DM Sans adds a touch more character than Inter for body text with its optical sizing.</p>
        <div class="pros-cons">
          <div class="pros" style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;"><strong>Strengths</strong>Feels premium and current. Great for data-heavy layouts. Both fonts render crisp at any size.</div>
          <div class="cons" style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;"><strong>Tradeoffs</strong>Similar enough to current that the change may feel subtle. Doesn't add personality jump.</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </a>

    <!-- 3. Plus Jakarta Sans + Nunito Sans -->
    <a href="preview.html?h=Plus+Jakarta+Sans&b=Nunito+Sans&label=Warm+%26+Friendly" class="font-card">
      <div class="font-card-hero">
        <img src="../images/wide_maroc.jpg" alt="Preview">
        <div class="overlay"></div>
        <div class="hero-text">
          <div class="hero-title" style="font-family:'Plus Jakarta Sans',sans-serif;">Bringing<br>Data to<br>Life</div>
          <div class="hero-divider"></div>
          <div class="hero-roles">
            <span style="font-family:'Plus Jakarta Sans',sans-serif;">Applied Data Scientist</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Plus Jakarta Sans',sans-serif;">Software Engineer</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Plus Jakarta Sans',sans-serif;">Product Leader</span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="font-card-body">
        <div class="font-card-label">
          <span class="pairing-name" style="font-family:'Plus Jakarta Sans',sans-serif;">Warm & Approachable</span>
          <span class="font-names">Plus Jakarta Sans + Nunito Sans</span>
        </div>
        <div class="sample-heading" style="font-family:'Plus Jakarta Sans',sans-serif;">Human-Centered Data</div>
        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'Nunito Sans',sans-serif;">Says "I'm technical but I can explain things to anyone." Jakarta's rounded strokes feel inviting without being childish. Nunito Sans is the friendliest readable body font on Google Fonts.</p>
        <div class="pros-cons">
          <div class="pros" style="font-family:'Nunito Sans',sans-serif;"><strong>Strengths</strong>Approachable. Great if your audience includes non-technical stakeholders or recruiters.</div>
          <div class="cons" style="font-family:'Nunito Sans',sans-serif;"><strong>Tradeoffs</strong>Can lean too soft for a serious data science portfolio. Less "edge."</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </a>

    <!-- 4. Outfit + Inter -->
    <a href="preview.html?h=Outfit&b=Inter&label=Clean+Minimal" class="font-card">
      <div class="font-card-hero">
        <img src="../images/wide_maroc.jpg" alt="Preview">
        <div class="overlay"></div>
        <div class="hero-text">
          <div class="hero-title" style="font-family:'Outfit',sans-serif;">Bringing<br>Data to<br>Life</div>
          <div class="hero-divider"></div>
          <div class="hero-roles">
            <span style="font-family:'Outfit',sans-serif;">Applied Data Scientist</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Outfit',sans-serif;">Software Engineer</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Outfit',sans-serif;">Product Leader</span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="font-card-body">
        <div class="font-card-label">
          <span class="pairing-name" style="font-family:'Outfit',sans-serif;">Clean Minimal</span>
          <span class="font-names">Outfit + Inter</span>
        </div>
        <div class="sample-heading" style="font-family:'Outfit',sans-serif;">Let the Work Speak</div>
        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'Inter',sans-serif;">Outfit strips away quirks &mdash; no distinctive terminals, no personality hooks. It's a "stay out of the way" heading font that makes your content the star. Paired with Inter, it's invisible design.</p>
        <div class="pros-cons">
          <div class="pros" style="font-family:'Inter',sans-serif;"><strong>Strengths</strong>Ultra-clean. Never clashes with any content. Timeless and professional.</div>
          <div class="cons" style="font-family:'Inter',sans-serif;"><strong>Tradeoffs</strong>Almost too safe. Nothing memorable about the typography itself. Forgettable.</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </a>

    <!-- 5. DM Sans + IBM Plex Sans -->
    <a href="preview.html?h=DM+Sans&b=IBM+Plex+Sans&label=Polished+Corporate" class="font-card">
      <div class="font-card-hero">
        <img src="../images/wide_maroc.jpg" alt="Preview">
        <div class="overlay"></div>
        <div class="hero-text">
          <div class="hero-title" style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;">Bringing<br>Data to<br>Life</div>
          <div class="hero-divider"></div>
          <div class="hero-roles">
            <span style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;">Applied Data Scientist</span>
            <span style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;">Software Engineer</span>
            <span style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;">Product Leader</span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="font-card-body">
        <div class="font-card-label">
          <span class="pairing-name" style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;">Polished Corporate</span>
          <span class="font-names">DM Sans + IBM Plex Sans</span>
        </div>
        <div class="sample-heading" style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;">Enterprise-Ready</div>
        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'IBM Plex Sans',sans-serif;">DM Sans is tight and assured. IBM Plex was literally designed for one of the world's largest tech companies. Together they say "I build things at scale." Serious without being stuffy.</p>
        <div class="pros-cons">
          <div class="pros" style="font-family:'IBM Plex Sans',sans-serif;"><strong>Strengths</strong>Reads as experienced and credible. IBM Plex is excellent for data tables and code-adjacent content.</div>
          <div class="cons" style="font-family:'IBM Plex Sans',sans-serif;"><strong>Tradeoffs</strong>Can feel corporate rather than creative. Less personality than a personal portfolio might want.</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </a>

    <!-- 6. Manrope + Source Sans 3 -->
    <a href="preview.html?h=Manrope&b=Source+Sans+3&label=Soft+Geometric" class="font-card">
      <div class="font-card-hero">
        <img src="../images/wide_maroc.jpg" alt="Preview">
        <div class="overlay"></div>
        <div class="hero-text">
          <div class="hero-title" style="font-family:'Manrope',sans-serif;">Bringing<br>Data to<br>Life</div>
          <div class="hero-divider"></div>
          <div class="hero-roles">
            <span style="font-family:'Manrope',sans-serif;">Applied Data Scientist</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Manrope',sans-serif;">Software Engineer</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Manrope',sans-serif;">Product Leader</span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="font-card-body">
        <div class="font-card-label">
          <span class="pairing-name" style="font-family:'Manrope',sans-serif;">Soft Geometric</span>
          <span class="font-names">Manrope + Source Sans 3</span>
        </div>
        <div class="sample-heading" style="font-family:'Manrope',sans-serif;">Balanced & Versatile</div>
        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'Source Sans 3',sans-serif;">Manrope is the goldilocks geometric &mdash; more warmth than Outfit, more structure than Jakarta. Source Sans 3 (Adobe's first open-source font) is battle-tested for readability at any size.</p>
        <div class="pros-cons">
          <div class="pros" style="font-family:'Source Sans 3',sans-serif;"><strong>Strengths</strong>Works everywhere. Great at large hero sizes AND small card text. Zero learning curve for readers.</div>
          <div class="cons" style="font-family:'Source Sans 3',sans-serif;"><strong>Tradeoffs</strong>Middle-of-the-road. Doesn't make a statement &mdash; just quietly works.</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </a>

    <!-- 7. Poppins + Inter -->
    <a href="preview.html?h=Poppins&b=Inter&label=Popular+Modern" class="font-card">
      <div class="font-card-hero">
        <img src="../images/wide_maroc.jpg" alt="Preview">
        <div class="overlay"></div>
        <div class="hero-text">
          <div class="hero-title" style="font-family:'Poppins',sans-serif;">Bringing<br>Data to<br>Life</div>
          <div class="hero-divider"></div>
          <div class="hero-roles">
            <span style="font-family:'Poppins',sans-serif;">Applied Data Scientist</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Poppins',sans-serif;">Software Engineer</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Poppins',sans-serif;">Product Leader</span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="font-card-body">
        <div class="font-card-label">
          <span class="pairing-name" style="font-family:'Poppins',sans-serif;">Popular Modern</span>
          <span class="font-names">Poppins + Inter</span>
        </div>
        <div class="sample-heading" style="font-family:'Poppins',sans-serif;">The Crowd Favorite</div>
        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'Inter',sans-serif;">Poppins is the most used geometric sans on the internet &mdash; Canva, Spotify, countless startups. It's popular for a reason: perfectly round, extremely legible, feels "designed" without trying hard. Worth seeing to accept or reject.</p>
        <div class="pros-cons">
          <div class="pros" style="font-family:'Inter',sans-serif;"><strong>Strengths</strong>Universally liked. Huge weight range. Proven at every size. Feels polished and modern instantly.</div>
          <div class="cons" style="font-family:'Inter',sans-serif;"><strong>Tradeoffs</strong>So popular it can feel like a template. You'll see it on 40% of portfolios you visit.</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </a>

    <!-- 8. Bricolage Grotesque + DM Sans -->
    <a href="preview.html?h=Bricolage+Grotesque&b=DM+Sans&label=Quirky+Character" class="font-card">
      <div class="font-card-hero">
        <img src="../images/wide_maroc.jpg" alt="Preview">
        <div class="overlay"></div>
        <div class="hero-text">
          <div class="hero-title" style="font-family:'Bricolage Grotesque',sans-serif;">Bringing<br>Data to<br>Life</div>
          <div class="hero-divider"></div>
          <div class="hero-roles">
            <span style="font-family:'Bricolage Grotesque',sans-serif;">Applied Data Scientist</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Bricolage Grotesque',sans-serif;">Software Engineer</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Bricolage Grotesque',sans-serif;">Product Leader</span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="font-card-body">
        <div class="font-card-label">
          <span class="pairing-name" style="font-family:'Bricolage Grotesque',sans-serif;">Quirky Character</span>
          <span class="font-names">Bricolage Grotesque + DM Sans</span>
        </div>
        <div class="sample-heading" style="font-family:'Bricolage Grotesque',sans-serif;">Personality Forward</div>
        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;">Bricolage has distinctive ink traps and quirky joints that make headings instantly recognizable. It says "I'm a creative thinker who happens to do data science." DM Sans keeps body text grounded.</p>
        <div class="pros-cons">
          <div class="pros" style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;"><strong>Strengths</strong>Memorable. Stands out from every other data portfolio. Great at large sizes on the hero.</div>
          <div class="cons" style="font-family:'DM Sans',sans-serif;"><strong>Tradeoffs</strong>The quirks can feel distracting. May not land well with conservative hiring managers.</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </a>

  </div>

  <div class="section-divider">Bold & Distinctive Pairings</div>

  <div class="font-grid">

    <!-- 9. Unbounded + Source Sans 3 -->
    <a href="preview.html?h=Unbounded&b=Source+Sans+3&label=Bold+Statement" class="font-card">
      <div class="font-card-hero">
        <img src="../images/wide_maroc.jpg" alt="Preview">
        <div class="overlay"></div>
        <div class="hero-text">
          <div class="hero-title" style="font-family:'Unbounded',sans-serif;font-size:1.3rem;">Bringing<br>Data to<br>Life</div>
          <div class="hero-divider"></div>
          <div class="hero-roles">
            <span style="font-family:'Unbounded',sans-serif;">Applied Data Scientist</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Unbounded',sans-serif;">Software Engineer</span>
            <span style="font-family:'Unbounded',sans-serif;">Product Leader</span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="font-card-body">
        <div class="font-card-label">
          <span class="pairing-name" style="font-family:'Unbounded',sans-serif;">Bold Statement</span>
          <span class="font-names">Unbounded + Source Sans 3</span>
        </div>
        <div class="sample-heading" style="font-family:'Unbounded',sans-serif;">Maximum Impact</div>
        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'Source Sans 3',sans-serif;">Unbounded is unapologetically chunky and rounded &mdash; headings demand attention like a billboard. It says "I'm confident and I don't blend in." Multiple weights available so it works across the full site.</p>
        <div class="pros-cons">
          <div class="pros" style="font-family:'Source Sans 3',sans-serif;"><strong>Strengths</strong>Impossible to ignore. Creates strong visual hierarchy. Memorable first impression.</div>
          <div class="cons" style="font-family:'Source Sans 3',sans-serif;"><strong>Tradeoffs</strong>Can feel heavy. Needs careful sizing &mdash; hero titles may need to be scaled down.</div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </a>

    <!-- 10. JetBrains Mono + Source Sans 3 -->

        <div class="font-card-label">
          <span class="pairing-name" style="font-family:'JetBrains Mono',monospace;">Engineer Identity</span>
          <span class="font-names">JetBrains Mono + Source Sans 3</span>
        </div>
        <div class="sample-heading" style="font-family:'JetBrains Mono',monospace;">Terminal Native</div>
        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'Source Sans 3',sans-serif;">Monospaced headings are a bold identity choice &mdash; it says "I live in notebooks and terminals, and I'm not pretending otherwise." JetBrains Mono is the most refined mono font available: ligatures, great weights, designed for hours of reading. Instantly distinctive from every other data science portfolio.</p>
        <div class="pros-cons">
          <div class="pros" style="font-family:'Source Sans 3',sans-serif;"><strong>Strengths</strong>Unmistakable identity. Full weight range. Looks incredible at large hero sizes. Signals deep technical credibility.</div>
          <div class="cons" style="font-family:'Source Sans 3',sans-serif;"><strong>Tradeoffs</strong>Monospaced headings take more horizontal space. Can feel like a dev blog rather than a portfolio.</div>
        </div>

        <p class="sample-text" style="font-family:'Inter',sans-serif;">Serif headings + sans body is the highest-contrast pairing possible. Playfair says "editorial, considered, scholarly." It communicates that you think deeply before you build. Inter keeps it modern.</p>
